components.description: The symbol for a baby, usually used to indicate a room that is suitable to change a baby in. Often located in or near public restrooms.
components.title: Baby Symbol

description: The symbol for a baby, usually used to indicate a room that is suitable to change a baby in. Often located in or near public restrooms.
title: Baby Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: The symbol for a baby, usually used to indicate a room that is suitable to change a baby in. Often located in or near public restrooms. Baby http://emojipedia.org/baby-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: baby symbol

bn:00108940a: Carrying developing offspring within the body.
Carrying developing offspring within the body or being about to produce new life

bn:00085991v: To creep; to move slowly on hands and knees, or by dragging the body along the ground.
Move slowly; in the case of people or animals with the body near the ground
To move slowly with the body in a prone position resting on or close to the ground.
To move slowly with the abdomen close to the ground.

bn:00007630n: A very young human being, from birth to somewhere between six months and two years of age, needing almost constant care and/or attention.
A very young human being, from birth to a year old.
Babies are the very young offspring of a human or other mammal.
An infant is the very young offspring of a human or animal.
A young child in the first years of life.
A very young human, particularly from birth to a couple of years old or until walking is fully mastered.
A baby or infant; a very young human or animal.
A very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk

bn:00018345n: A pickpocket; a young or petty thief.
A piece or strip of potato that has been (usually deep-fat) fried and is commonly eaten with or as fast food.
A young person of either sex
A person not legally of age, or who is younger than may be charged with an offence
In law, a minor is a person under a certain age -- usually the age of majority -- which legally demarcates childhood from adulthood.
An account holder who is a family member, but not a parent, and who has limited use of the Internet. Children can view their own settings, but they can't change them.
A person who is too young to be considered legally competent according to the laws of a jurisdiction.
Age of majority, Legal age, Infancy
A person who is below the legal age of responsibility or accountability.
A person below the age of puberty.
A person who is below the age of adulthood; a minor .

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the baby symbol emoji appears as a clear, universally recognized icon of a simplified baby. Rendered with Apple's characteristic smooth gradients and soft, rounded edges, it conveys a sense of innocence and new beginnings. The subtle 3D shading adds a touch of gentle realism to the clean design, often used to signify childbirth, parenthood, or anything related to infants and young children.
